Okay, this is for fun. It's some what politial but it is supposed to be fun.
 Here's the game. If you were to see any celebraty of your choice run for president, who would it be. It doesn't matter what age, gender or what country they are from. If they are from another country which would mean that the constitution would need to be changed, mark (if you know it) what country they are from or put a * by their name. Ready?
 
 
 A celebraty I would vote for would be Bruce Springsteen. emoticon_cool Then he would go from being "The Boss" to "The Pres."
My choice: Fred Dalton Thompson (US Senator from Tennessee and actor, currently on Law&Order as DA Arthur Branch)
Bugs Bunny. He couldn't be any worse than what we have now. And hes cute and furry which may help to get other countries to like us again.

Ben Affleck all the way :)

 ICK!
 I'd go for Bugs Bunny too.

I would go for Mickey Mouse. He is very quailifed.
 
 1) He already runs a "small world" of his own.
 2) He is internationally known and liked.
 3) He is always positive
 4) The first lady would be an old fashion girl.
 5) He has lead an army before (mousekateers)
 6) Always seems to have an idea on how to fix things, and when that fails he uses majic.
 7) He is a senior citizen so he would appeal to the old
 8) He is cute and adorable so he would appeal the young.
 
 
 I would put a number 10, but I ran out of ideas....
 
 He gets my vote.
Ok forget Bugs, I'm voting Mickey! :)

Hey, you just described Ronald Reagan. BTW whaddyathink of my choice, Fred Thompson?

 Great actor. I love him in movies. As far as Making him president...No, I don't think so. I would rather see someone with no political history or experience. It would be nice to get a fresh perspective in the white house. I don't think our president should have to be a career politician or legal expert. A commons sense lay-person who surrounds themself with intelligent people certainly could do no worse than most of our recent presidents. (Reagan excluded)

I was wondering (and the same goes for Bugs Bunny) would lack of a
 Viatnam record make it hard for them to get ellected? That was the big deal in the 2004 election. 
 
 
 Quite honestly, I think Bugs or Mickey could get elected even if they aren't war heroes. After all, Kerry had a record of Vietnam service while Bush screwed around and Bush still got elected. emoticon_idea

Quite honestly, I think Bugs or Mickey could get elected even if they aren't war heroes. After all, Kerry had a record of Vietnam service while Bush screwed around and Bush still got elected. emoticon_idea

 Yes, but what I meant was that during the last election, everyone made a big deal about Vietnam and the record both Kerry and Bush had in it. Even though Bush screwed around, he still had a record of that. I personally don't think that military record should really matter. Some of America's greatest war generals got elected president and were not that good at being president. Main point: I was just poking fun at the Vietnam deal that arose last year.
